value: File:Church and the Port of Milna, Croatia.jpg
Church and the Port of Milna

is a city on the island of
Buses run several times a day from

, the village where the ferry docks.  Unfortunately, they stop in the late afternoon or early evening -- even in summer!, so you must rent a scooter or car, or take a taxi. 

A car rental will let you explore the island and reach idyllic beaches.
A small old town with the harbor, which is quite big for a town that small. Large international marina attracts boaters.  Lots of stone.  The harbor is also where it is where all is happening.

Relax at the harbor, (great people watching!)  go to nearby beaches; hike; visit the small galleries; walk through the old streets of this village; beautiful photos of old stone houses, sky and sea. Music on summer evenings.
Vino, port wine, Karlovacko, fresh fish and the best cafe lattes East of Italy! Fresh produce market daily.  Home made wine and brandy.

For renting of a local apartments you can contact the local tourist information or some of the locals rent out their apartments in the summer.

Serenity Retreat
, glorious harbor views from gorgeous stone apartments on hill in old town; terraces; barbeque; garden.  30 seconds from the harbour.  Milna-born host.
